chargeHist.descr: Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime

result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher K Morley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.075(1r).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Provide a DNA Sample.  
Sex Offender Registry for 15 years.  
Absolute sobriety.  
Comply with all prescription medications.  
No contact with anyone under the age of 18 without prior agent approval.  No internet access without prior agent approval.  If approved, purchase internet tool and allow agent access to view all internet activity.  May not reside within 1,000 feet of school, park, daycare or any place children congregate.  
No possession of any photography, which depicts individual under the age of 18.  
Complete AODA assessment and follow through 100% with recommendations.  Participate and complete a cognitive intervention Program.  Payment of all court obligations and DOC supervison fees.  
Complete any other treatment as deemed appropriate by WI DOC

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Defendant Christopher K Morley in court with attorney Jeremey Michael Campshure.  Defendant Christopher K Morley in custody.  Gregory A. Parker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PSI received and reviewed by the parties.  No factual corrections.  DA Parker calls Detective CG, sworn in and testifies about the investigation.  Exhibits 1- 6 are introduced and eventually admitted.  To be sealed.  Objection to relevence- Overruled.  Atty Campshure questions the detective about the exhibits.  Re-direct by DA Parker.  Detective JS sworn in and testifies.  Exhibit #7 marked and introduced.  Detective reads some quotes from letters.  Exhibit 7 admitted.  Cross by Atty Campshure.  Defendant sister sworn in by the Judge and reads a statement to the court and to the defendant.  Atty Campshure addresses the defendant.  Arguments for sentencing.  Recess for some research to be done regarding sex offender registry.  Resume at 1pm.  Court resumes at 1:10pm

Subpoena for 6/10/2016 - Sentencing Hearing

Defendant Christopher K Morley in court with attorney Jeremey Michael Campshure.  Defendant Christopher K Morley in custody.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Campshure - parties have an agreement, PLQ filed w/NC plea.  DA Parker  agrees to cap recommendation at 5 years initial incarceration, requests PSI and psych & sexual evaluation.   Atty Campshure will argues against PSI and evaluations, DE want to proceed to sentencing today.  DA Parker will argue against.  Court questions DE, reviews rights, charges & penalties w/DE, Advises DE of Voting & Firearms rights.  Court accepts waiver, plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty.  Atty Campshure-DE has been in custody since Oct. , believes he can get needed treatment in Prison.  DA Parker - feels this type of case demands a PSI and a Psycho Sexual evaluation would be beneficial for Extended Supervision.  Atty Campshure - evaluations can be done when he enters Dodge Correctional.  Court feels it should have the information available at sentencing to properly sentence DE.  orders PSI & Pyscho Sexual Evaluation. Court reminds DE of bond conditions.   Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 10, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Subpoenas for 10/30/2015
Pre-trial conference at 11-20-2015 09:13 am

Defendant Christopher K Morley in court with attorney Jeremey Michael Campshure.  Defendant Christopher K Morley in custody.  Gregory A. Parker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises party of his right, accepts waiver and binds over.  Defense waives reading of the Information.  Defendant enters a plea of not guilty.  Defense requests a modification of bond conditions.  Remarks by Atty. Campshure and Atty. Parker.  Court makes its findings - motion denied at this point.  Bond continues.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 20, 2015 at 09:13 am.
Jeremey Camphshure

Defendant Christopher K Morley in court with attorney Jeremey Michael Campshure.  Defendant Christopher K Morley in custody.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing requested.  Attny Campshure argues for a bond reduction.  Denied by the Court.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 30, 2015 at 02:00 pm.  Defendant had sent a motion for bond reduction to the Court (which was not reviewed) and gives to defense counsel to review.

Defendant Christopher K Morley in court, in custody.  Scott Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has no one available to contact.  Court advises defendant to contact local attorneys.  Court will not modify bond.  Bond continued.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

No contact with anyone under age 18--only incidental contact.  No travel outside the state without prior court approval.  No possession of a firearm.  Do not use or possess any device that can access the internet.  No contact with his wife directly except 3rd party contact to access finances.
Defendant Christopher K Morley appeared by video means. Prosecuting Atty Gregory A. Parker appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
